definitions: To suspend or be suspended from above with the lower part free.
To kill (someone) by tying a rope from above to the neck and allowing the body to drop.
To remain in the air; to float.
To attach or be attached to a wall.
To be suspended in a threatening way.
To decorate with pictures or drapes.
To remain static or stuck (e.g., a computer program).
To spend time idly or in a particular place.
examples: She will hang the picture on the wall.
The clothes hang on the line.
The jury will hang the criminal.
The mist hangs over the valley.
They like to hang out at the mall.
